item.title: Niobium-carbide MXene Modified Hybrid Hole Transport Layer Enabling High-performance Organic Solar Cells Over 19%
item.description: Niobium-carbide (Nb2C) MXene as a new two-dimensional material has shown great potential for application in photovoltaics due to its excellent electrical conductivity, large surface area and superior transmittance. In this work, we have developed a novel solution-processable PEDOT:PSS-Nb2C hybrid hole transport layer (HTL) to enhance the device performance of organic solar cells (OSCs). By optimizing the doping ratio of Nb2C MXene in PEDOT:PSS, the best power convention efficiency (PCE) of 19.
